metadata.Title: CVE-2022-1130 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Insufficient validation of trust input in WebOTP in Google Chrome onAndroid prior to 100.0.4896.60 allowed a remote attacker to send arbitraryintents from any app via a malicious app.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1130` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 100.0.4896.127-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 100.0.4896.127-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 100.0.4896.127-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 100.0.4896.127-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 100.0.4896.127-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '100.0.4896.127-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
